title: Studies after Andrea Mantegna, Giulio Romano, and the Antique

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pen and brown ink, with brush and brown wash, on off-white laid paper.

medium_display: Pen and brown ink, with brush and brown wash, on off-white laid paper
credit_line: Gift of Richard and Mary L. Gray
publication_history:
Vasari Society for the Reproduction of Drawings by Old Masters (Oxford University Press, 1912), vol. 7, no. 29.  

Walter Friedlaender and Anthony Blunt, The Drawings of Nicolas Poussin: Catalogue raisonné (Warburg Institute, 1974), vol. 5, no. 347, pl. 266.  

Anthony Blunt, The Drawings of Poussin (Yale University Press, 1979), pp. 142–43, fig. 161.  

Anthony Blunt, Les dessins de Poussin (Hazan, 1988), pp. 158–59, fig. 141.  

Pierre Rosenberg and Louis-Antoine Prat, Nicolas Poussin, 1594–1665: Catalogue raisonné des dessins (Leonardo, 1994), vol. 1, pp. 402–03, no. 206.
exhibition_history:
Paris, Galerie Aubry, Dessins français et italiens du XVIe et du XVIIe siècles, 1971, cat. 83.  

Art Institute of Chicago, Gray Collection: Seven Centuries of Art, Sept. 25, 2010–Jan. 2, 2011, cat. 47 (ill.).

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Rubens, Rembrandt, and Drawing in the Golden Age", September 28, 2019 - January 5, 2020.

UC Berkeley Art Museum and Pacific Film Archive, "Pure Drawing: Seven Centuries of Art from the Gray Collection", August 4 - November 28, 2021.
provenance_text: Lord Arundel [according to 1881 Bale sale cat.]. Marquis de Lagoy [stamp (Lugt 1710) recto, lower right, in black].  Comte Moriz von Fries [blind stamp (Lugt 2903) recto, lower left]. Sir Thomas Lawrence, c. 1820 [blind stamp (Lugt 2445) recto, lower left].  William Russel [according to Sotheby's 1918]. Charles Sackville Bale [stamp (Lugt 640) verso, lower center, in black]; sold, Christie's, London, June 9, 1881, lot 2406.  Sir Edward John Poynter [stamp (Lugt 874) recto, lower left, in blue]; sold, Sotheby's, London, Apr. 25, 1918, lot 224, to Douglas. Alfred Normand, Paris, from c. 1950 [stamp (Lugt 153c) recto, lower left and verso, lower right, in purple]. Sold by Salamander Fine Arts, London, to Richard and Mary L. Gray, Chicago, Apr. 12, 2007; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2019.

input: Studies after Andrea Mantegna, Giulio Romano, and the Antique
